page.title: 18Local Flora
page.content: Goring and the surrounding area has quite a large number of trees some in plantations and many natural ones. The main species are sycamore,chestnut, willow and beech trees. As can be seen the area is mostly covered by deciduous trees,a few conifers are grown in the plantations,scots pine. Through the year the cycle of flowers follows a typical pattern.In the woods the snowdrops emerge followed by the primrose wood anemones and the bluebells. Hedgerows flowers include dandelions, buttercups and daisies, all the common ones are to be found. There is a patch of ground in the Dblock which has some most unusual plants growing, to find out more, contact B.B.O.N.T.
